block.p: Three units of the Interpublic Group of Companies are making acquisitions for undisclosed terms.

FutureBrand in New York, a worldwide brand consulting agency, acquired Dollery Rudman Freibauer, a brand development agency in Toronto, and merged it with FutureBrand Hypermedia, a digital branding company also in Toronto.
Three units of the Interpublic Group of Companies are making acquisitions for undisclosed terms.

FutureBrand in New York, a worldwide brand consulting agency, acquired Dollery Rudman Freibauer, a brand development agency in Toronto, and merged it with FutureBrand Hypermedia, a digital branding company also in Toronto.

The merged agency, FutureBrand Canada, has 40 employees and revenue estimated at more than $6.7 million from clients like Air Canada, the Hudson's Bay Company and Nabisco. Ed Freibauer, 37, managing partner at Dollery Rudman, was named managing director at FutureBrand Canada.

Golin/Harris International in Chicago acquired the MWW Group in East Rutherford, N.J., a public relations agency with 250 employees and revenue estimated at $37 million from clients like Hard Rock Cafe International, McDonald's New York Tri-State Restaurants and the New Jersey Lottery. Michael Kempner, 42, continues as president and chief executive at MWW, which will operate as an autonomous unit of Golin/ Harris.
Finally, Octagon Worldwide in London and New York, a marketing and entertainment agency group, acquired Movie and Media Sports in London, a marketing company to be renamed Octagon Movie and Media.
